Chords

Module Summary

Module containing code related to chords.

Imports

intervals: Import functions and Interval class.

notes: Import the Note class.

datahelper: Import the get_json_file().

Global variables

chords.all_chords: dict

Contains all chord names and intervals as keys and notes as values.

chords.CHORD_NAMES_INTERVALS: list[str]

Contains all the chord names and intervals.

chords.CHORD_NOTES: list[str]

Contains all the chord notes.

Functions

get_chord_names(): Take chord notes and return their names.

get_chord_notes(): Take a chord name and return its notes.

get_chord_intervals(): Take a chord name and return its intervals.

get_chord(): Return a chord based on a name or notes.

chord_input(): Handle input and output of chords.

display_chord_information(): Display information on a given chord.

run(): Run module as a script.

Classes

ChordNames: Handle chord names.

ChordIntervals: Handle chord intervals.

ChordNotes: Handle chord notes.

Chord: Groups the other classes in a single object.

Functions

chords.get_chord_names(notes_str: str) → ChordNames

Get chord names using notes in a string.

Obtains the index of the string notes in CHORD_NOTES and uses it on CHORD_NAMES_INTERVALS to get the corresponding names.

Parameters:

notes_str (str) – The notes of a chord in a string.

Returns:

The names of the chord.

Return type:

ChordNames

chords.get_chord_notes(name_str: str) → ChordNotes

Get the notes of a chord using a name on a string.

Gets the index of the string name in CHORD_NAMES_INTERVALS and uses it on CHORD_NOTES to get the corresponding notes. Afterwards, use a list comprehension instantiating each note as a notes.Note object and returns the list as a ChordNotes object.

Parameters:

name_str (str) – The name of the chord as a string.

Returns:

The notes of the chord.

Return type:

ChordNotes

chords.get_chord_intervals(name_str: str) → ChordIntervals

Get the chord’s intervals using its name on a string.

Finds the intervals iterating on CHORD_NAMES_INTERVALS and comparing each item with the string name, then split the item to get the portion of the string corresponding to the intervals. Last, uses a list comprehension instantiating each interval as an intervals.Interval object and turns the list into a ChordIntervals object.

Parameters:

name_str (str) – The name of the chord in a string.

Returns:

The intervals of the chord.

Return type:

ChordIntervals

chords.get_chord(name_param='', notes_param='') → Chord

Take either a chord’s name or notes and returns its object.

Uses the get_chord_names(), get_chord_intervals() and get_chord_notes() functions to retrieve the components of the chord, then instantiates and returns it.

Parameters:

  • name_param (str) – The name of the chord in a string.

  • notes_param (str) – The notes of the chord in a string.

Returns:

The chord object.

Return type:

Chord

chords.chord_input(mode='') → Chord

Handle input of chords.

Parameters:

mode (str) – Whether the chord’s input will be by name or notes.

Returns:

A chord object.

Return type:

Chord

chords.display_chord_information(chord: Chord)

Show information about a chord.

Uses the ChordNames.get_names_information(), ChordIntervals.get_intervals_information() and ChordNotes.get_notes_information() methods to display all information on a given chord.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – A given chord object.

chords.run()

Run the module as a script.

Classes

ChordNames Summary

class chords.ChordNames(names: list[str])

Class with methods pertaining to chord names.

Attributes

items: list[str]

The items (names) of the chord.

Methods

get_alternative_names(): Get alternative names for the chord.

get_names_information(): Get the information on the names.

__init__(names: list[str])

Instantiate the chord names.

Parameters:

names (list[str]) – Passed to items.

ChordNames Methods

ChordNames.get_alternative_names(notes_str: str)

Get the chord’s names with different note orders.

Takes a string of chord notes, iterates through it, changes their place using their index and uses get_chord_names() to get the names using the new note order.

Parameters:

notes_str (str) – The string of notes of the chord.

ChordNames.get_names_information() → str

Return a message with all the chord names.

ChordIntervals Summary

class chords.ChordIntervals(intervals: list[musicinpython.intervals.Interval])

Class containing methods related to chord intervals.

Attributes

items: list[intervals.Interval]

The chord’s intervals in a list.

Methods

assign_notes_to_intervals(): Assign notes to the intervals.

get_intervals_information(): Get information on the intervals.

__init__(intervals: list[musicinpython.intervals.Interval])

Instantiate the chord intervals.

Parameters:

intervals (list[intervals.Interval]) – Passed to items.

ChordIntervals Methods

ChordIntervals.assign_notes_to_intervals(note_list: list[musicinpython.notes.Note])

Assign the notes in a list to the intervals of the object.

Iterates through items, using the indexes to assign the notes in the list to each interval.

Parameters:

note_list (list[notes.Note]) – List of notes to be used.

ChordIntervals.get_intervals_information() → str

Return a message with information on all the intervals.

Utilizes intervals.all_about_interval() to add data to the message returned and then appends the interval’s notes.

Returns:

A message with the interval’s data.

Return type:

str

ChordNotes Summary

class chords.ChordNotes(notes: list[musicinpython.notes.Note])

Class with methods related to chord notes.

Attributes

items: list[notes.Note]

The notes of a chord.

Methods

get_notes_str(): Get a string of the notes.

get_notes_information(): Get information on all the notes.

__init__(notes: list[musicinpython.notes.Note])

Instantiate the chord notes.

Parameters:

notes (list[notes.Note]) – Passed to items.

ChordNotes Methods

ChordNotes.get_notes_str() → str

Iterate on the notes and return their names as a string.

ChordNotes.get_notes_information() → str

Return a message with information on all the notes.

Uses notes.all_about_note() on each note on items and appends the information to the returning message.

Returns:

The message containing note information.

Return type:

str

Chord Summary

class chords.Chord(chord_name: ChordNames, chord_intervals: ChordIntervals, chord_notes: ChordNotes)

Class that groups the chord components into a single object.

names: ChordNames

The chord’s names.

intervals: ChordIntervals

The chord’s intervals.

notes: ChordNotes

The chord’s notes.

__init__(chord_name: ChordNames, chord_intervals: ChordIntervals, chord_notes: ChordNotes)

Instantiate a chord object.

Passes parameters to attributes and then calls ChordIntervals.assign_notes_to_intervals() and ChordNames.get_alternative_names() to complete them.

Parameters:

  • chord_name (ChordNames) – Passed to names.

  • chord_intervals (ChordIntervals) – Passed to intervals.

  • chord_notes (ChordNotes) – Passed to notes.
